searchData.contentSummary: Pumpkin CMS is a modern, open-source, Git-backed headless CMS perfect for Philadelphia agencies, startups, and enterprises. Lightning-fast content editing, Next.js-ready, fully free core with optional cloud hosting.

content.title: Why Philadelphia Agencies Are Switching to Pumpkin CMS
content.subtitle: A deep dive into the modern headless CMS movement
content.author: Jamie Chen
content.authorBio: Developer Advocate at Pumpkin CMS, based in Philadelphia
content.excerpt: Philadelphia's web development scene is embracing headless CMS technology. Here's why Pumpkin CMS is becoming the go-to choice for local agencies.
content.body:
# The Philadelphia Web Development Renaissance

Philadelphia has always been a hub for innovation, and the city's web development community is no exception. Over the past year, we've seen a remarkable shift toward modern, Git-based headless CMS solutions.

## Why the Change?

Traditional CMSs like WordPress served us well for years, but modern web development demands more. Philadelphia agencies are building with Next.js, React, and edge computing—technologies that traditional CMSs weren't designed for.

### Key Benefits Philadelphia Teams Are Seeing:

1. **Performance**: Sites built with Pumpkin CMS routinely achieve 100 Lighthouse scores
2. **Developer Experience**: Git-backed content means familiar workflows
3. **Flexibility**: True content modeling without database constraints
4. **Cost**: Open source means no vendor lock-in

## Real Stories from Philly

We talked to three Philadelphia agencies who made the switch...

content.title: Pumpkin CMS FAQs – Philadelphia Edition
content.subtitle: Common questions from Philly developers and agencies

items.question: Is Pumpkin CMS really free?
items.answer: Yes! The entire core is MIT-licensed and free forever. Optional paid cloud hosting and enterprise support are available.

items.question: Can I self-host Pumpkin CMS?
items.answer: Absolutely. One-click deploy to Vercel/Netlify or run on your own Docker/K8s cluster.

items.question: Do you have a Philadelphia Slack or meetup?
items.answer: Yes! Join our #philadelphia channel in the official Slack and come to our monthly meetups at Indy Hall.

items.question: Does it work with Next.js App Router?
items.answer: Built for it. Full App Router examples in the repo.

items.question: Can editors use it without knowing code?
items.answer: Yes – the block-based visual editor is designed for marketing teams and content editors.

items.question: How do I get help in Philadelphia?
items.answer: Book a free 30-min call with our Philly-based team or hire one of our certified local partners.
